member.name: T:Vortex.Adapters.Connector.Tc3.Adapter.SymbolLoadingMode
member.summary: Enumerates way the symbols will be loaded from the PLC.

member.name: F:Vortex.Adapters.Connector.Tc3.Adapter.SymbolLoadingMode.AfterConnectorConstruction
member.summary:
The symbols are loaded and linked when the connector is created.
This mode considerably slows down the start of the application. All symbols are loaded and linked regardless the usage by the application.

member.name: F:Vortex.Adapters.Connector.Tc3.Adapter.SymbolLoadingMode.PreLoadSymbolsLinkOnTheFly
member.summary:
The symbols are loaded but not linked. Linking is deferred at the first symbol use during the life time of the application.
This mode slows down the start up of the application. All symbols are loaded regardless the usage by the application.

member.name: F:Vortex.Adapters.Connector.Tc3.Adapter.SymbolLoadingMode.LoadAndLinkOnTheFly
member.summary: The symbols are loaded and linked when first time required by the application. This is the fastest way of starting up the application. The symbol loading and linking are performed in a lazily during the application life time.

member.name: T:Vortex.Adapters.Connector.Tc3.Adapter.SymbolLoadMethod
member.summary: Enumerates symbol loading methods.

member.name: F:Vortex.Adapters.Connector.Tc3.Adapter.SymbolLoadMethod.SymbolInfoReader
member.summary: Using symbol info loader. Generally faster method for on the fly loading of the symbols.

member.name: F:Vortex.Adapters.Connector.Tc3.Adapter.SymbolLoadMethod.SymbolInfoLoader
member.summary: Using symbol info reader. Generally slower method suitable for small-mid size applications.

member.summary: Gets the server port.

member.name: P:Vortex.Adapters.Connector.Tc3.AdsConnector.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether synchronous access should be suspended. Typically this value should be set to true during extensive reflection operation when synchronous access to the controller is not required. Suspending synchronous access considerably improves performance. N.B. Suspended synchronous access bypasses all synchronous read and write operations with no further warning.
Gets or sets the timeout for connector operations.
